sentences.sContent: Most students rent rooms in their second year.
sentences.sCn: 大多数学生到二年级时租房居住。

sentences.sContent: I’d rather have my own house than rent.
sentences.sCn: 我更想有自己的房子，不想租房。

sentences.sContent: ...but you can also rent camping spaces in Sweden...
...the web makes it easier for companies to rent out spare offices and idle machines...
...Some people have bought cars solely to rent them out...
...People who rent out rooms should pay tax...
...Car owners who rent their vehicles to others using RelayRides make an average of $250 a month; some make more than $1...
...By six o'clock that evening I had signed contracts with seven companies to rent plants from me and pay me a fee to maintain them...

phrases.pCn: 房屋出租；公寓招租；吉屋出租

words.tran: 承租人；佃户；房东；（英）影片出租商
（法）年金，年收入；长期公债，公债利息

trans.tranOther: to regularly pay money to live in a house or room that belongs to someone else, or to use something that belongs to someone else
the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else
